Operation 'get_/.well-known/mercure' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate the Mercure protocol context. Description is completely missing. Added clarity about the subscription mechanism (query parameters for topics), the push mechanism (SSE), authentication requirements, and connection behavior for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.summary_suggestion: Subscribe to Mercure topic updates via HTTP
data.description_suggestion: Establishes a subscription to one or more Mercure topics to receive real-time updates. Clients send topic URIs as query parameters to specify which topics to subscribe to. The server maintains the connection open and pushes updates to subscribed topics as Server-Sent Events (SSE). Requires appropriate authentication (Bearer token or Cookie) based on topic authorization. The connection remains active until the client disconnects or the server closes it.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate the Mercure protocol context. Description is completely missing. Added clarity about the subscription mechanism (query parameters for topics), the push mechanism (SSE), authentication requirements, and connection behavior for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'post_/.well-known/mercure' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary lacks Mercure protocol context. Description is missing entirely. Added details about request body structure (topics and data), authentication/authorization requirements, delivery mechanism, response behavior, and multi-topic support to enable AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.description_suggestion: Publishes an update to one or more Mercure topics. The request body contains the topic URI(s) to publish to and the update data. Only authenticated publishers with appropriate authorization can publish updates. The update is immediately delivered to all active subscribers of the specified topics. Returns HTTP 200 on successful publication. Supports publishing to multiple topics in a single request.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks Mercure protocol context. Description is missing entirely. data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all currently active subscriptions across all topics in the Mercure hub. Returns subscription metadata including topic URIs, subscriber identifiers, and connection information. Requires appropriate authentication and authorization to access subscription data. This operation is typically used for monitoring, debugging, or administrative purposes to understand the current state of all active connections.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague and doesn't indicate scope (all subscriptions). Description is missing. Added context about what data is returned, authentication requirements, and typical use cases to help AI agents understand the operation's purpose and when to invoke it.

data.current_summary: Active subscriptions for the given topic
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all active subscriptions for a specific topic URI. The topic parameter should be a valid Mercure topic URI. Returns subscription metadata for all subscribers currently listening to this topic, including subscriber identifiers and connection information. Requires appropriate authentication and authorization. Useful for monitoring topic-specific subscription activity or understanding subscriber distribution.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description is missing entirely. Added details about parameter format (topic URI), return value structure, authentication requirements, and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Active subscription for the given topic and subscriber
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves subscription details for a specific subscriber on a specific topic. Both topic and subscriber parameters are required identifiers. Returns subscription metadata including connection status, subscription timestamp, and other relevant connection information. Requires appropriate authentication and authorization. Returns HTTP 200 if the subscription exists, or appropriate error status if not found. Useful for verifying active subscriptions or retrieving specific subscription details.
